Package controller

Class PongGameController

java.lang.Object
controller.PongGameController
public class PongGameController extends Object
The PongController class contains the main logic for controlling the pong gameplay
Version:
June 16, 2024
Author:
Andrew Polyak

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PongGameController(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane gameView, javafx.scene.shape.Circle ball, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle plyPaddle, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle oppPaddle, javafx.scene.text.Text plyScore, javafx.scene.text.Text oppScore, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane gameEndPane, javafx.scene.text.Text gameResultMsg, javafx.scene.text.Text plyName, String username, javafx.scene.control.Button forfeitBtn)
    The PongController constructor takes in a number of JavaFX objects which represent the pong game stage, paddles, ball, and user interface
    It additionally instantiates key objects such as SecureRandom so as to randomly decide the starting direction of the ball
    Finally, gameOn, the boolean value representing whether the game is running, is set to true

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    addScore(javafx.scene.text.Text scoreTracker)
    The addScore method increments a score tracker (whether it be the player's or opponent's) by 1
    private boolean
    ballAboveOppPaddle()
    The ballAboveOppPaddle method checks whether the ball's Y coordinates are above the center of the opponent's paddle
    private boolean
    ballBelowOppPaddle()
    The ballBelowOppPaddle method checks whether the ball's Y coordinates are below the center of the opponent's paddle
    private boolean
    ballTouchingBottomOfPaddle(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
    The ballTouchingBottomOfPaddle method detects whether the ball touches the bottom 20px of the paddle
    private boolean
    ballTouchingLeftWall()
    The ballTouchingLeftWall method detects if the ball is touching the left wall of the field (i.e., the opponent's goal post)
    private boolean
    ballTouchingRightWall()
    The ballTouchingRightWall method detects if the ball is touching the right wall of the field (i.e., the player's goal post)
    private boolean
    ballTouchingTopOfPaddle(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
    The ballTouchingTopOfPaddle method detects whether the ball touches the top 20px of the paddle
    private void
    bounceBall()
    The bounceBall method detects ball collisions and appropriately bounces the ball off of the relevant obstacle
    A speed boost is applied a limited number of times for each bounce as well
    private void
    bounceOffPaddle(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
    The bounceOffPaddle method bounces the ball off of the relevant paddle
    Bouncing only occurs if the bounce cooldown has elapsed (to prevent ball from getting stuck in paddle)
    If the ball touches the top of the paddle, always bounce it upward with a slight speed increase (vice versa for bottom)
    private void
    bounceOffWall()
    The bounceOffWall method reverses ball's Y-axis movement & increments numBounces
    private void
    checkForGameEnd()
    The checkForGameEnd method detects whether a player won
    If a player has won, the displayResults method is subsequently called
    private void
    checkForScore()
    The checkForScore method checks if a player has scored
    If a player has scored, then they are awarded 1 point
    The ball is then reset and begins moving again
    private void
    directBall()
    The method directBall moves the ball 1 X & 1 Y coordinate
    private void
    directBallDown()
    The method directBallUp moves the ball 1 Y coordinate downward
    private void
    directBallLeft()
    The method directBallLeft moves the ball 1 X coordinate to the left
    private void
    directBallRight()
    The method directBallRight moves the ball 1 X coordinate to the right
    private void
    directBallUp()
    The method directBallUp moves the ball 1 Y coordinate upward
    private void
    displayResults()
    The displayResults method stops the ball and displays the end of game message informing the player whether they won or lost
    boolean
    getPlyWon()
     
    private void
    increaseVelocity()
    The increaseVelocity method applies a speed boost to the x and y velocity up to a specified limit
    private void
    moveBall()
    The moveBall method contains the key logic for moving the ball around the field

    If gameOn is true (i.e., the game has started and no player has won):
    - Call directBall to set ball's velocity & trajectory
    - Call bounceBall to detect ball collisions & redirects ball accordingly
    private void
    moveOppPaddle()
    The moveOppPaddle method controls the AI of the opponents paddle
    If the ball is above the paddle, it moves up (and vice versa for below)
    private void
    moveOppPaddleDown()
    The moveOppPaddleDown method moves the opponent's paddle downward
    private void
    moveOppPaddleUp()
    The moveOppPaddleUp method moves the opponent's paddle upward
    private void
    movePlyPaddle()
    The movePlyPaddle method allows the user to control their paddle
    The Y position of their paddle is equal to the Y position of their mouse
    private boolean
    paddleCollision(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
    The paddleCollision method detects whether the ball is in contact with a paddle (whether it be the player's or opponent's)
    private void
    resetBall()
    The resetBall method resets the ball to the field center and randomly applies a skew to its Y position spawn
    The ball's velocity, bounce tracker, and beginning movement parameters are all reset as well
    void
    startGame()
    The startGame method instantiates an AnimationTimer to begin the "frames" of the game
    void
    stopGame()
    The stopGame method ends the game
    private boolean
    wallCollision()
    The wallCollision method detects ball contact with the ceiling or floor

  • Constructor Details

    • PongGameController

      public PongGameController(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane gameView, javafx.scene.shape.Circle ball, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle plyPaddle, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle oppPaddle, javafx.scene.text.Text plyScore, javafx.scene.text.Text oppScore, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane gameEndPane, javafx.scene.text.Text gameResultMsg, javafx.scene.text.Text plyName, String username, javafx.scene.control.Button forfeitBtn)
      The PongController constructor takes in a number of JavaFX objects which represent the pong game stage, paddles, ball, and user interface
      It additionally instantiates key objects such as SecureRandom so as to randomly decide the starting direction of the ball
      Finally, gameOn, the boolean value representing whether the game is running, is set to true
      Parameters:
      gameView -
      ball -
      plyPaddle -
      oppPaddle -
      plyScore -
      oppScore -
      gameEndPane -
      gameResultMsg -

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      The startGame method instantiates an AnimationTimer to begin the "frames" of the game

    • stopGame

      public void stopGame()
      The stopGame method ends the game

    • moveBall

      private void moveBall()
      The moveBall method contains the key logic for moving the ball around the field

      If gameOn is true (i.e., the game has started and no player has won):
      - Call directBall to set ball's velocity & trajectory
      - Call bounceBall to detect ball collisions & redirects ball accordingly

    • directBall

      private void directBall()
      The method directBall moves the ball 1 X & 1 Y coordinate

    • bounceBall

      private void bounceBall()
      The bounceBall method detects ball collisions and appropriately bounces the ball off of the relevant obstacle
      A speed boost is applied a limited number of times for each bounce as well

    • checkForScore

      private void checkForScore()
      The checkForScore method checks if a player has scored
      If a player has scored, then they are awarded 1 point
      The ball is then reset and begins moving again

    • resetBall

      private void resetBall()
      The resetBall method resets the ball to the field center and randomly applies a skew to its Y position spawn
      The ball's velocity, bounce tracker, and beginning movement parameters are all reset as well

    • checkForGameEnd

      private void checkForGameEnd()
      The checkForGameEnd method detects whether a player won
      If a player has won, the displayResults method is subsequently called

    • displayResults

      private void displayResults()
      The displayResults method stops the ball and displays the end of game message informing the player whether they won or lost
      Parameters:
      plyWon -

    • bounceOffPaddle

      private void bounceOffPaddle(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
      The bounceOffPaddle method bounces the ball off of the relevant paddle
      Bouncing only occurs if the bounce cooldown has elapsed (to prevent ball from getting stuck in paddle)
      If the ball touches the top of the paddle, always bounce it upward with a slight speed increase (vice versa for bottom)
      Parameters:
      paddle -

    • movePlyPaddle

      private void movePlyPaddle()
      The movePlyPaddle method allows the user to control their paddle
      The Y position of their paddle is equal to the Y position of their mouse

    • moveOppPaddle

      private void moveOppPaddle()
      The moveOppPaddle method controls the AI of the opponents paddle
      If the ball is above the paddle, it moves up (and vice versa for below)

    • ballAboveOppPaddle

      private boolean ballAboveOppPaddle()
      The ballAboveOppPaddle method checks whether the ball's Y coordinates are above the center of the opponent's paddle
      Returns:
      true if the ball is above, false otherwise

    • ballBelowOppPaddle

      private boolean ballBelowOppPaddle()
      The ballBelowOppPaddle method checks whether the ball's Y coordinates are below the center of the opponent's paddle
      Returns:
      true if the ball is below, false otherwise

    • moveOppPaddleUp

      private void moveOppPaddleUp()
      The moveOppPaddleUp method moves the opponent's paddle upward

    • moveOppPaddleDown

      private void moveOppPaddleDown()
      The moveOppPaddleDown method moves the opponent's paddle downward

    • directBallLeft

      private void directBallLeft()
      The method directBallLeft moves the ball 1 X coordinate to the left

    • directBallRight

      private void directBallRight()
      The method directBallRight moves the ball 1 X coordinate to the right

    • directBallUp

      private void directBallUp()
      The method directBallUp moves the ball 1 Y coordinate upward

    • directBallDown

      private void directBallDown()
      The method directBallUp moves the ball 1 Y coordinate downward

    • wallCollision

      private boolean wallCollision()
      The wallCollision method detects ball contact with the ceiling or floor
      Returns:
      true if in contact, false otherwise

    • bounceOffWall

      private void bounceOffWall()
      The bounceOffWall method reverses ball's Y-axis movement & increments numBounces

    • paddleCollision

      private boolean paddleCollision(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
      The paddleCollision method detects whether the ball is in contact with a paddle (whether it be the player's or opponent's)
      Parameters:
      paddle -
      Returns:
      true if the ball contacts the paddle, false otherwise

    • increaseVelocity

      private void increaseVelocity()
      The increaseVelocity method applies a speed boost to the x and y velocity up to a specified limit

    • ballTouchingLeftWall

      private boolean ballTouchingLeftWall()
      The ballTouchingLeftWall method detects if the ball is touching the left wall of the field (i.e., the opponent's goal post)
      Returns:
      true if ball is touching the left wall, false otherwise

    • ballTouchingRightWall

      private boolean ballTouchingRightWall()
      The ballTouchingRightWall method detects if the ball is touching the right wall of the field (i.e., the player's goal post)
      Returns:
      true if ball is touching the right wall, false otherwise

    • addScore

      private void addScore(javafx.scene.text.Text scoreTracker)
      The addScore method increments a score tracker (whether it be the player's or opponent's) by 1
      Parameters:
      scoreTracker -

    • ballTouchingTopOfPaddle

      private boolean ballTouchingTopOfPaddle(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
      The ballTouchingTopOfPaddle method detects whether the ball touches the top 20px of the paddle
      Parameters:
      paddle -
      Returns:
      true if the ball touches the top portion of the paddle, false otherwise

    • ballTouchingBottomOfPaddle

      private boolean ballTouchingBottomOfPaddle(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle paddle)
      The ballTouchingBottomOfPaddle method detects whether the ball touches the bottom 20px of the paddle
      Parameters:
      paddle -
      Returns:
      true if the ball touches the bottom portion of the paddle, false otherwise

      public boolean getPlyWon()
      Returns:
